reviews.text:
Great location. Great building. From Waterloo you can get to almost anywhere in London. The Station has had so many upgrades and the latest is the use of the old Euro Star tracks and station. With new Toilets, new links to the Underground lines below, and of course the connecting walkway to the London Eye. Inside the Station it has opened more shops and restaurants. The Old cast iron structure has been conserved, cleaned and it looks good. 
You really feel great at this busy hub. 
From connecting to the Imax Cinema, to the walkways of Waterloo Bridge and their views of London, it is truly a masterpiece, unmissable.

A very nice station, well laid out and staffed. Can get very busy during peaks however so it is beneficial to plan ahead. Staff as always are extremely helpful and will quickly point you in the right direction if needed.

The staff at the barrier are the most rude and inconsiderate humans I have ever come across. Coming from a patient facing, caring profession, I would have terminated their contract if I was their employer. I have been commuting through Waterloo everyday for the past 5 years, my commute over the past few months has been the worst!

A very good station with train services to south west London, Surrey, Hampshire, Dorset and Devon. There are plenty of train services and there are also plenty of shops and food outlets. Plus the toilets are very big and free!

Very important train station because it has connections to other important stations all around London.  Staff are helpful and friendly here.  There are long distance trains coming here.  Prices are a bit expensive but it's worth it.
